STATE OF MICHIGAN
GRETCHEN WHITMER DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR LANSING DIRECTOR
June 23, 2022
Brian Lingle
South Bluff Teaching Family Home
1005 Silver Creek Rd.
Marquette, MI 49855
RE: License #: CI520304229
Investigation #: 2022C0227004
South Bluff Teaching Family Home
Dear Mr. Lingle:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
A six-month provisional certificate of approval is recommended. If you do not contest
the issuance of a provisional license, you must indicate so in writing; this may be
included in your corrective action plan or in a separate document. If you contest the
issuance of a provisional certificate of approval, you must notify this office in writing
and an administrative hearing will be scheduled. Even if you contest the issuance of
a provisional license, you must still submit an acceptable corrective action plan.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager Jessica VandenHeuvel at (616) 204-6992.

Sincerely,
Jennifer Pastorick, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
305 Ludington St.
Escanaba, MI 49829
(906) 280-3979
enclosure

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
SPECIAL INVESTIGATION REPORT
*** This report contains quoted profanity and sexually implicit information***
I. IDENTIFYING INFORMATION
License #: CI520304229
Investigation #: 2022C0227004
Complaint Receipt Date: 05/11/2022
Investigation Initiation Date: 05/11/2022
Report Due Date: 07/10/2022
Licensee Name: Teaching Family Homes of Upper Michigan
Licensee Address: 1000 Silver Creek Road
Marquette, MI 49855
Licensee Telephone #: (906) 249-5437
Administrator: James Whalen, Designee
Licensee Designee: James Whalen, Designee
Name of Facility: South Bluff Teaching Family Home
Facility Address: 1005 Silver Creek Rd.
Marquette, MI 49855
Facility Telephone #: (906) 249-5437
Original Issuance Date: 10/05/2009
License Status: REGULAR
Effective Date: 05/01/2022
Expiration Date: 04/30/2024
Capacity: 8
Program Type: CHILD CARING INSTITUTION, PRIVATE
1

II. ALLEGATION(S)
Violation
Established?
Youth are not allowed to have cell phones. Two youth at the Yes
facility are in possession of a cell phone and have been using the
cell phone and a laptop to engage in inappropriate sexual
behavior with men virtually. There have been past concerns of
inappropriate sexual behavior between the two youth, and they
have been inside a room alone together recently.
Additional Findings: Youth were out of the direct supervision of Yes
staff and variable interval eye on checks of the youth were not
completed in intervals not to exceed 15 minutes.
III. METHODOLOGY
05/11/2022 Special Investigation Intake
2022C0227004

Telephone call made to previous consultant
05/11/2022 Contact - Telephone call made

05/11/2022 Contact - Telephone call made
Foster care worker
05/11/2022 Contact - Telephone call made
Foster care worker
05/12/2022 Inspection Completed On-site
Interview staff, review policy and procedures, obtain documents
05/12/2022 Contact - Telephone call received
Received message from Detective
05/12/2022 Contact - Telephone call made
Phone call to Detective
05/13/2022 Contact - Telephone call made
Phone contact with Executive Director regarding safety plan
05/16/2022 Contact - Telephone call made
Email to coordinated with MDHHS worker
05/17/2022 Contact - Face to Face
Interview staff, review documents with MDHHS worker
05/25/2022 Contact - Telephone call made
Phone call with MDHHS worker
05/26/2022 Contact - Face to Face
Review staff files on site
05/31/2022 Contact - Face to Face
Interview staff with MDHHS worker, pre exit meeting with
Executive Director
2

06/01/2022 Contact - Telephone call made
Attempted contact with staff for interview with MDHHS worker
06/07/2022 Contact - Telephone call made
Phone contact with MDHHS worker
06/07/2022 Contact - Telephone call made
Attempted contact with staff for interview with MDHHS worker
06/07/2022 Contact - Telephone call made
Interview staff with MDHHS worker
06/08/2022 Contact- Telephone call made
Interview staff with MDHHS worker
ALLEGATION:
Youth are not allowed to have cell phones. Two youth at the facility are in
possession of a cell phone and have been using the cell phone and a laptop to
engage in inappropriate sexual behavior with men virtually. There have been past
concerns of inappropriate sexual behavior between the two youth, and they have
been inside a room alone together recently.
INVESTIGATION:
Interviews:
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 5/12/2022 and 5/17/2022 in
collaboration with MDHHS worker. Staff 1 is the Program Facilitator at the facility.
Staff 1 reported she worked on 5/10/2022 from 2pm-10pm. Staff 1 reported she
picked up Youth A from school and Youth A had an unauthorized cell phone on her
person that she had had for the last week. Youth A was on the cell phone in the car
on the way back to the house with an unknown male that Youth B introduced her to.
Staff 1 told Youth A that she was not allowed to be on the cell phone and Youth A
put the cell phone away. Staff 1 reported upon arriving back to the house Youth A
and Youth B were going outside the house without permission and were laying on
the hammock making TikTok videos and calling unknown people. Staff 1 reported
she was working the shift with Staff 2. Staff 1 reported while Youth A and Youth B
were outside the house that Staff 2 was working with another youth that was having
a rough day and she was watching the remainder of the youth and preparing dinner.
Staff 1 reported Youth A and Youth B were outside the home where she could see
them however, she was unable to hear their conversation for about 20 minutes.
Staff 1 reported Youth A and Youth B both have safety plans, and the safety plans
indicate staff are to be within hearing distance to monitor their conversation. Staff 1
reported that when she got close enough to Youth A and Youth B to hear their
conversation that Youth A and Youth B would threaten her, saying they would beat
her up. Staff 1 reported Youth B came into the house and Staff 1 prompted her with
the expectations of following staff directions and put her shoes in the closet. Youth B
refused. Staff 1 explained that due to the concerns with Youth B leaving the facility
without permission that staff had been having Youth B put her shoes in the closet.
Staff 1 reported she followed Youth B to her room to attempt to get her shoes.
3

Youth A went to her own bedroom. Staff 1 reported Youth B then went back outside
to the hammock.
Staff 1 finished preparing dinner and knocked on Youth A’s door to let her know
dinner was ready. Staff 1 reported Youth A began swearing at Staff 1 through the
door. Staff 1 opened Youth A’s bedroom door to address her swearing and Youth A
was topless on a video chat with an unknown male. Staff 1 reported she closed
Youth A’s door and redirected Youth A not to swear at staff. Staff 1 did not address
Youth A regarding being on video chat with an adult male while she was topless.
Staff 1 reported Youth A came out of her bedroom, ignored staff direction, and went
outside the house. Youth A and Youth B were outside on the hammock together
until 6pm. Staff 1 reported that Staff 2 monitored Youth A and Youth B by looking
out the window during this time. Staff 1 did not recall what time Youth A and Youth
B went outside without permission.
Staff 1 reported when Youth A and Youth B came back into the house they wanted
to go into the den. Staff 1 and Staff 2 told Youth A and Youth B they were not
allowed in the den based on it being a privilege and they were not following the
expectations. Staff 1 reported Youth A and Youth B stormed outside and tried to
climb through the den window. Staff 1 reported Youth A and Youth B were
threatening her and Staff 2 during this time. Staff 1 called the on-call supervisor,
Supervisor 2, and notified him of what was going on. Staff 1 reported Youth A and
Youth B were locked out of the house at this point and were kicking the door telling
her and Staff 2 to let them in the house. Staff 1 reported she was not opening the
door as Youth A and Youth B were saying they were going to beat her and Staff 2
up. Staff 1 reported she and Staff 2 watched Youth A and Youth B through the
window and on the video cameras. Staff 1 reported Youth A and Youth B ran to the
fire exit door on the side of the house and Youth B kicked the door in to get back into
the house. Staff 1 reported Youth A and Youth B then went into Youth B’s bedroom
and closed the door. Staff 1 reported the door was closed for 1-2 minutes and she
and Staff 2 opened the door and Youth B was standing in her bra. Staff 1 reported
Youth B then shut the door on her. Staff 1 reported she and Staff 2 sat outside the
closed door for 30 minutes waiting trying to de-escalate Youth A and Youth B until
Supervisor 2 arrived. Staff 1 opened the door to find Youth B in her bra and Youth B
slammed the door on Staff 1. Staff 1 reported Youth A and Youth B then exited
Youth B’s bedroom and went to Youth A’s bedroom and closed the door. Staff 1
reported Youth A and Youth B put items in front of Youth A’s door so staff could not
open the door. Staff 1 reported she sat outside Youth A’s bedroom door with the
door closed and listened to Youth A and Youth B’s conversation for two and a half
hours. Staff 1 reported she did not feel safe to intervene and enter Youth A’s room
when Youth A and Youth B were in there during the 2.5 hours.
Staff 1 reported Supervisor 2 came to the house and brought ice cream for the other
youth. Supervisor 2 helped Staff 2 with other youth. Staff 1 reported Supervisor 2
was not at the house the whole time. Staff 1 reported Supervisor 2 did not intervene
4

at all. Staff 1 reported Supervisor 2 was at the home for about 30 minutes with the
other youth and got the other youth ice cream.
Staff 1 reported she heard Youth A and Youth B on the cell phone with Youth A’s
boyfriend making plans to leave the facility at 9:30pm. Staff 1 reported she heard
Youth A and Youth B talking to a male and described what she thought as Youth A
and Youth B watching and encouraging a male to masturbate for them. Staff 1
reported Youth A and Youth B were telling an unknown male that Youth A would
give him blow jobs. Staff 1 reported she heard Youth A and Youth B watching and
making TikTok’s. Staff 1 reported she heard Youth A and Youth B packing a bag.
Staff 1 reported she sat outside the door writing notes for the incident reports. Staff
1 reported she did not enter the room as staff should not enter youth rooms without
another staff and Staff 2 was with the other youth in the house. Staff 1 reported
Supervisor 2 had left the house. Staff 1 reported she did not contact police on
5/10/2022. Staff 1 reported Supervisor 1 and Supervisor 2 told staff that
Administrator 3 stated for staff not to physically intervene to take the cell phones
away from Youth A and Youth B. Staff 1 reported around 8:30pm Youth A and Youth
B did agree to take their medication and Staff 1 was able to position herself in Youth
A’s doorway to monitor the youth. Staff 1 reported around 9pm Youth B left Youth
A’s room and went to her room. Staff 1 reported she was told by Supervisor 1 and
Supervisor 2 that it was not trauma informed to try to take the cell phones away from
Youth A and Youth B. Staff 1 reported staff completed room searches and would
take away cell phone chargers when they would find them.
Staff 1 reported she worked on 5/11/2022 when Youth A and Youth B went AWOLP
from the facility. Staff 1 reported Youth A and Youth B walked out of the house at
4pm and she was able to follow them until about 4:15pm when she lost sight. Staff 1
reported she notified Supervisor 2 while following Youth A and Youth B and again
when she lost sight. Staff 1 reported she continued to look for Youth A and Youth B
in the woods after she lost sight but was unable to locate them. Staff 1 reported she
contacted police around 5pm and filed AWOLP reports. Staff 1 reported she thought
Youth A and Youth B went to meet up with Youth A’s boyfriend. Staff 1 reported
Youth A’s boyfriend was believed to be the unknown male she was talking to on the
video chat. Staff 1 reported Youth A and Youth B have gone AWOLP together prior.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 5/17/2022, in collaboration
with MDHHS worker. Staff 2 is a direct care worker at the facility. Staff 2 reported
she worked on 5/10/2022 from 3pm-11pm. Staff 2 reported on 5/10/2022 Youth A
and Youth B were outside the house using technology inappropriately. Staff 2
reported she was checking on Youth A and Youth B by watching them from inside the
house by looking out the window. Staff 2 reported Youth A and Youth B came back
inside the house and wanted to be let into the den to continue using their phones.
Staff 2 reported Youth A and Youth B were told that they would not be let into the den
as that was a privilege for the other youth that were in there watching television as the
other youth were following program expectations. Youth A and Youth B then exited
the house out the front door and went to the den window to try to get in by climbing
5

through the outside window. Staff 2 reported Youth A and Youth B were threatening
to hurt her and Staff 1. Staff 2 reported Youth A and Youth B were unable to open the
den window as staff had locked it. Staff 2 reported she and Staff 1 closed the front
door behind the youth and the door locks. Youth A and Youth B came back to the
front door to gain entrance back into the house and Staff 1 and Staff 2 did not open
the locked door for the youth to come back into the house due to Youth A and Youth
B threatening staff. Youth A and Youth B ran to the side fire exit door on the right side
of the house and kicked in the door to gain entrance back into the home. Youth A and
Youth B then went into Youth B’s bedroom and were slamming the bedroom door in
Staff 1 and Staff 2’s face telling staff to stay out of the bedroom.
Staff 2 reported Staff 1 sat outside Youth B’s room with the door closed listening to
Youth A and Youth B’s conversation through the door. Staff 2 reported Youth A and
Youth B were in the bedroom with the door closed for about 15 minutes. Youth A and
Youth B then exited Youth B’s bedroom. Staff 2 reported she and Staff 1 attempted to
talk to Youth A and Youth B about not being in one another’s bedrooms however the
youth did not listen, and Youth A and Youth B then went to Youth A’s bedroom and
closed the door on staff. Staff 2 reported Supervisor 2 was called and informed of the
situation. Staff 2 reported Youth A and Youth B were in Youth A’s room for 45 minutes
or longer. Staff 2 reported Youth A and Youth B were having inappropriate video
conversations and explained the conversation as hearing Youth A saying “faster, do
it faster” and reported that Youth A and Youth B were encouraging an unknown adult
male to masturbate for them on video.
Staff 2 reported Youth A had been walking around the house all afternoon with an
unknown adult male on video chat on the cell phone. Staff 2 reported she was not able
to get close enough to Youth A to take the phone away. Staff 2 reported she felt if
she attempted to take the cell phones away from Youth A and Youth B that the youth
would hurt her. Staff 2 reported Supervisor 2 arrived at the house around 7:30pm and
was at the house with Staff 1 and Staff 2 for about 45 minutes. Staff 2 reported she
did not know if Supervisor 2 attempted to intervene with Youth A and Youth B. Staff
2 reported staff did not intervene when Youth A and Youth B were in Youth A’s
bedroom due to feeling unsafe and stated she had previously been hit by Youth A.
Staff 2 reported she and Supervisor 2 were with the other youth in the home during
this time. Staff 2 reported she would cover Staff 1 when Staff 1 needed a break, by
sitting outside the door and listening. Staff 2 reported she heard Youth A and Youth
B talking about leaving the facility. Staff 2 reported Youth A and Youth B calmed down
around 9pm and Youth B left Youth A’s room. Staff 2 reported Administrator 3 informed
staff not to put themselves in a physically harmful situation over a cell phone. Staff 2
reported not feeling safe to intervene to try to get the cell phones from Youth A and
Youth B with Staff 1. Staff 2 reported since Youth A and Youth B went AWOLP there
is a new safety plan in place for when they return that has been shared with staff.
Staff 2 reported she was not working when Youth A and Youth B went AWOLP on
5/11/2022.
6

Staff 3 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 5/12/2022 and via phone
on 6/10/2022. Staff 3 is the social services worker at the facility. Staff 3 reported
she worked 5/8/2022 most of the day into the early hours of the morning. Staff 3
was the on-call supervisor on 5/8/2022. Staff 3 reported Youth B spent most of the
weekend in her room as she believed she was leaving the facility on Monday. Staff
3 reported Youth B came out of her room with an unauthorized phone as she did not
have privileges to have a phone. Youth B engaged Youth A in watching TikTok’s
with her on the phone. Staff 3 reported Youth A and Youth B went into Youth B’s
room around 10:45pm and were attempting to close the door on Staff 3. Staff 3
described the youth closing the door on her 2-3 times before Staff 3 was able to
position herself in the doorway. Staff 3 reported Youth A and Youth B were blasting
music and making threats to Staff 3. Staff 3 called police to report the threats as
Youth A was stating she was going to beat up Staff 3 and kill her. Staff 3 reported
law enforcement informed Staff 3 that they would not be responding unless the
youth were actively acting on the threats. Staff 3 reported she sat in the doorway of
Youth B’s room supervising the youth with the door open until 3am when Youth A
decided to go back to her bedroom. Staff 3 reported she felt she and Staff 4 would
have gotten hurt if they attempted to take the phones away and the laptop computer.
Staff 3 reported she did not want to escalate the situation. Staff 3 reported she felt
that if staff attempted to get the cell phones and laptop, Youth A and Youth B would
have fought, and the situation would have ended in a restraint. Staff 3 reported she
used verbal de-escalation with Youth A and Youth B and gave verbal commands for
Youth A and Youth B to provide the cell phones to staff. Staff 3 reported Youth A
and Youth B did not give staff the cell phones as verbally directed.
Staff 3 reported she attempted to contact Administrator 1 and was unable to make
contact with him. Staff 3 reported she contacted Administrator 3 two to three times
during the shift she worked on 5/8/2022. Staff 3 informed Administrator 3 Youth A
and Youth B had cell phones and Youth B was in Youth A’s bedroom. Staff 3
informed Administrator 3 that Youth A and Youth B were on video chat with an
unknown male and had him masturbating. Staff 3 reported Administrator 3 advised
her to continue monitoring Youth A and Youth B but not to try to take the cell phones
away. Staff 3 reported she did not recall why Administrator 3 advised her not to take
the cell phones away.
Staff 4 was interviewed via telephone on 6/8/2022 in collaboration with MDHHS
worker. Staff 4 is a direct care worker at the facility. Staff 4 reported she was
working the night shift at South Bluff the few days leading up to Youth A and Youth B
going AWOLP. Staff 4 reported she was not able to remember all the details. Staff
4 reported when she was on shift with Staff 3 that Youth A and Youth B were in
Youth B’s room on the cell phones and laptop computer speaking to unknown
males. Staff 4 reported the conversations were inappropriate and sexual in nature.
Staff 4 reported Youth A and Youth B had an unknown male masturbating for them
on video. Staff 4 reported Youth B eventually tried to stop Youth A from continuing
with the video at which time Youth A left Youth B’s bedroom with the cell phone and
went to her own bedroom and continued the communication with the unknown male.
7

Staff 4 reported Youth A could be heard moaning and engaging in the video
interaction with the unknown male. Staff 4 reported Youth A was moaning loudly
and was saying “cum for me daddy”. Staff 4 reported that when she arrived on shift
and Youth A and Youth B were together in Youth B’s bedroom that staff were sitting
outside Youth B’s bedroom door with the door open. Staff 4 did not recall what
specific staff were there. Staff 4 reported that staff avoid going into youth’s
bedrooms as there are no cameras. Staff 4 reported staff were told that they were
not to physically engage Youth A and Youth B to get the cell phones or laptop
computer. Staff 4 reported she was told this by several staff and that she did not
know who advised staff to not physically engage.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed via telephone on 6/7/2022 in collaboration with
MDHHS worker. Supervisor 1 is a Program Supervisor at the facility. Supervisor 1
reported Youth A and Youth B had unauthorized cell phones and staff attempted to
get the phones for several days however the youth would place the cell phones in their
bras and underwear. Supervisor 1 reported he was aware the youth were not allowed
to have the cell phones and were doing inappropriate things on the phones however
he felt it was unjustified to try to hold the youth down to get the phones when they
were in their undergarments. Supervisor 1 reported upper management advised if
staff were able to take the phones by just taking it from their hands that they could not
try to take the phones in the youth’s rooms as there was no cameras and the youth
have made accusations against staff previously. Supervisor 1 reported he felt that if
they tried to take the phones that it would have resulted in a physical altercation.
Supervisor 1 reported upper management informed staff not to initiate a physical
restraint to get the cell phones but if staff tried to take the cell phones and the youth
attempted to harm staff’s physical safety that staff were able to physically restrain the
youth.
Supervisor 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 5/12/2022 and on
5/17/2022 in collaboration with MDHHS worker and via phone on 6/10/2022.
Supervisor 2 is a Program Supervisor at the facility. Supervisor 2 reported he was the
on-call supervisor from 5/9/2022 - 5/11/2022. Supervisor 2 reported he was called on
5/10/2022 by Staff 1 due to Youth A and Youth B kicking in the fire exit door.
Supervisor 2 went to the house to assess the damage and contact on-call
maintenance to come in to fix the door. Supervisor 2 reported when he arrived at the
house Youth A and Youth B were in Youth A's bedroom. Supervisor 2 reported Youth
A and Youth B had unauthorized cell phones that they had been hiding in their bra
and underwear so staff could not get the phones. Supervisor 2 reported he contacted
Administrator 1 regarding Youth A and Youth B being in Youth A’s bedroom with the
door closed to address how staff should handle this. Supervisor 2 reported he asked
if he could take the bedroom door off so staff could supervise the youth and
Administrator 1 told him no. Supervisor 2 reported Staff 1 monitored Youth A and
Youth B by listening outside the door. Supervisor 2 reported he got ice cream for the
other youth as a reward for following program expectations. Supervisor 2 reported
Youth A and Youth B were holding Youth A’s bedroom door closed and were
threatening staff that they would assault them if they came in.
8

Supervisor 2 reported he was at the house for 2 hours that night and he was with the
other youth in the house showing positive attention for them following program
expectations. Supervisor 2 reported Staff 1 and Staff 2 were monitoring Youth A and
Youth B from outside the door, and he felt Staff 1 had the situation under control.
Supervisor 2 reported he was aware that Staff 1 felt unsafe. Supervisor 2 reported he
checked on Staff 1 and Staff 2 when they were listening outside Youth A’s bedroom
door and that Youth A and Youth B were threatening Staff 1 and Staff 2 through the
door. Supervisor 2 reported he did not attempt to open Youth A’s bedroom door due
to feeling it would result in Youth A and Youth B assaulting staff and he had been
advised by Administrator 3 not to physically intervene. Supervisor 2 reported he left
the house around 8pm and Youth A and Youth B were still in Youth A’s bedroom.
Supervisor 2 reported management stated for staff not to go hands on unless the
youth were in immediate danger. Supervisor 2 reported staff were advised to attempt
to get the cell phones by using verbal direction to give staff the cell phones. Supervisor
2 reported he was aware that Youth A and Youth B were video chatting people in the
bedroom together and having sexual conversations. Supervisor 2 reported Staff 1
told him that Youth A and Youth B were telling an unknown male the sexual things
they would do if they could get a ride. Supervisor 2 reported he felt it was a physical
safety concern for staff and youth if staff attempted to take the cell phones and that it
was better to monitor what they were doing than intervene by taking the cell phones.
Supervisor 2 reported he was aware that Youth A and Youth B had safety plans and
were to be always monitored visually and to hear their conversations.
Administrator 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 5/31/2022, in
collaboration with MDHHS worker by telephone. Administrator 1 reported he
supervises Supervisor 1 and Supervisor 2. Administrator 1 reported Youth B had not
been working the program for some time prior to going AWOLP. Administrator 1
reported Youth B had an off-campus job where she was able to get multiple cell
phones. Administrator 1 reported he was aware that Youth A and Youth B were using
the cell phones and sending inappropriate pictures and watching pornographic
material. Administrator 1 described the inappropriate pictures as Youth A and Youth
B sending topless pictures. Administrator 1 reported this went on for a couple days.
Administrator 1 reported Youth B talking to staff about having a friend coming to pick
her up from the facility. Administrator 1 told Youth B that if she leaves the facility
without permission that the facility will make a runaway report. Administrator 1
reported a few days later Youth A and Youth B went AWOLP from the facility.
Administrator 1 reported Staff 3 had called Administrator 3 for direction regarding
Youth A and Youth B being in each other’s bedrooms as well as having the
unauthorized cell phones and Administrator 3 advised Staff 3 not to restrain the youth
and to try to get the youth to willingly give staff the cell phones. Administrator 1
reported he was contacted on 5/9/2022 by Staff 3 informing him about some issues at
the home. Administrator 1 did not recall the conversation details. Monday morning
Staff 3, Administrator 1 and Administrator 3 talked about how to intervene with Youth
9

A and Youth B. Administrator 1 reported Staff 3 was not comfortable with restraining
Youth A and Youth B to get the cell phones as Youth A and Youth B were hiding the
cell phones in their bras and pants. Administrator 1 reported Youth A and Youth B
were not an imminent safety risk to themselves or others and that a restraint would
not be warranted to obtain the cell phones. Administrator 1 reported it was decided
the intervention plan would be to try to get Youth A and Youth B to willingly give the
cell phones up. Administrator 1 reported staff were informed to monitor Youth A and
Youth B on the cell phones and laptop and to continue to give verbal prompts to give
staff the cell phones.
Administrator 1 reported he was aware that Youth A and Youth B were watching
pornographic material and talking to an unknown male. Administrator 1 did not know
who the unknown male was and if the unknown male was on Youth A or Youth B’s
approved contact list however, he did not believe so. Administrator 1 reported the cell
phones were not taken away from Youth A and Youth B because staff are not able to
restrain youth to take away cell phones and can only ask youth to voluntarily give staff
the cell phones. Administrator 1 reported Youth A and Youth B were not complying
with staff asking them to voluntarily give the cell phones. Administrator 1 reported he
was not aware that Youth A and Youth B were locked out of the house by Staff 1 and
Staff 2. Administrator 1 reported it is not acceptable for staff to lock youth out of the
house. Administrator 1 reported he feels the facility was sufficiently staffed 5/9/2022,
5/10/2022, and 5/11/2022 according to the staffing plan and schedule.
Administrator 1 reported he was aware that Youth A and Youth B had safety plans.
Administrator 1 reported he did not believe Youth A and Youth B were to have contact.
Administrator 1 reported he was unaware if Youth A and Youth B were alone
unsupervised on 5/10/2022. Administrator 1 reported he was not aware that Staff 1
and Staff 2 did not have constant visual supervision on 5/10/2022 when Youth A and
Youth B were in Youth A’s bedroom for approximately two and a half hours.
Administrator 1 reported he was not aware that 15-minute checks were not completed.
Administrator 1 reported he was not aware that Youth A and Youth B were outside
without staff on 5/10/2022 and that Staff 1 and Staff 2 were in the house and would
look out the window to have a visual. Administrator 1 reported staff are to be outside
with youth supervising. Administrator 1 reported he was not aware that Supervisor 2
went into the facility on 5/10/2022. Administrator 1 reported he was not aware that
staff did not feel safe.
Administrator 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 5/31/2022 in
collaboration with MDHHS worker via telephone. Administrator 2 reported he was
aware of the situation that was occurring with Youth A and Youth B however he was
not involved in the in the moment decisions as he was not the on-call supervisor that
week. Administrator 2 reported Youth A and Youth B were keeping the unauthorized
cell phones on them by hiding them in their bras and underwear so staff could not get
the cell phones. Administrator 2 reported he was aware that Youth A and Youth B
were using the cell phones inappropriately by video chatting with unknown adult
males. Administrator 2 reported Youth A was found to be topless on a video chat with
10

an unknown male. Administrator 2 reported he was informed that Youth A had an
unknown male masturbate for her via video and that Youth A was loudly masturbating
back which he reported all the youth in the home were able to hear. Administrator 2
reported Youth A and Youth B’s unauthorized cell phones were not taken away as the
youth were keeping the cell phones in places that staff could not access such as their
bras and underwear. Administrator 2 reported when staff would approach Youth A
and Youth B they would put the phones in their bras or underwear, so staff did not
take them. Administrator 2 reported the only time staff could have possibly taken the
cell phones was when Youth A and Youth B were walking around the house with them.
Administrator 2 reported staff were guarded to take the cell phones due to concerns
Youth A and Youth B would become physically aggressive. Administrator 2 reported
Youth A and Youth B were not a harm to their self or others having the cell phones
and that it was not warranted to restrain the youth to get the cell phones. Administrator
2 reported he felt due to the type of inappropriate interaction that Youth A and Youth
B were having with unknown males on the phone that it did change the dynamic of the
situation. Administrator 2 reported he was not aware that Youth A and Youth B were
locked out of the house on 5/10/2022 and Staff 1 and Staff 2 refused to let them in.
Administrator 2 reported this was not appropriate for staff to do. Administrator 2
reported Youth A and Youth B had safety plans and he did not feel the safety plans
were followed as Youth A and Youth B were having unsupervised contact.
Administrator 2 reported he was not aware that Youth A and Youth B were outside the
house on 5/10/2022 while Staff 1 and Staff 2 were inside the home monitoring by
looking out the window. Administrator 2 reported staff are to always be outside with
youth.
Administrator 3 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 5/31/2022 in
collaboration with MDHHS worker via telephone. Administrator 3 reported Staff 3
contacted him regarding Youth A and Youth B having unauthorized cell phones and
were having communication with Youth A’s boyfriend. Administrator 3 reported Staff
3 asked if the youth should be restrained to obtain the cell phones and Administrator
3 said no due to the actions not warranting a restraint. Administrator 3 was contacted
again, and informed Youth A and Youth B were taking pictures of themselves and
sending them on the cell phones and advised staff not to restrain the youth as the
youth were not a risk to self or others. Administrator 3 reported he did not know that
the youth were taking nude pictures. Administrator 3 reported he was contacted again
by Staff 3 regarding Youth A and Youth B watching video of a man masturbating.
Administrator 3 reported he advised staff that Youth A and Youth B were not to be
restrained as they were not a risk to self or others. Administrator 3 reported Staff 3
and Staff 4 were the only two staff at the house on 5/9/2022 when Staff 3 was
contacting him, and he was concerned Youth A and Youth B would escalate if staff
attempted to take the cell phones. Administrator 3 reported his concern was if Youth
A and Youth B escalated in the bedrooms that there were no video cameras, and he
was concerned someone would get hurt. Administrator 3 reported Youth A or Youth
B’s caseworker had stated for staff not to take the cell phones. Administrator 3 did
not recall where he heard this.
11

Administrator 3 reported he was not familiar with all the situations that occurred on
5/10/2022. Administrator 3 reported he was not aware that Youth A and Youth B were
outside the house without staff supervision and that Staff 1 and Staff 2 were checking
on the youth by looking out the window. Administrator 3 reported he was not aware
that Youth A and Youth B were locked out of the house by Staff 1 and Staff 2 due to
them being concerned for their safety due to Youth A and Youth B making threats
about beating them up which led to Youth B kicking in the fire exit door to get back
into the house. Administrator 3 reported he was not aware of Youth A and Youth B’s
safety plans and that the youth were to be always supervised when together.
Administrator 3 reported at the time he was looking through the situation in a different
perspective and now views it as he will be changing the policy and no longer allowing
youth to have cell phones. Administrator 3 reported he looked into blocking cellular
data however he is unable to do that as it was unauthorized cell phones the youth
were using, and he did not have control to turn of the cellular data.
Youth A was interviewed via telephone on 6/1/2022 in collaboration with MDHHS
worker. Youth A reported she did not like the staff or other youth at the facility. Youth
A reported she had a cell phone at the facility that Youth B got for her. Youth A
reported she was not supposed to have a cell phone. Youth A reported staff tried to
take the cell phone from her, but she told staff that she would “beat her ass” if they
tried to take the cell phone. Youth A reported she had assaulted staff at the facility
and was not afraid of any of the staff. Youth A reported staff would put a chair in her
bedroom doorway and not let her close her door. Youth A reported staff tried to lock
her out of the house, but she kicked in the door. Youth A refused to participate in any
further interviewing.
Youth B was not interviewed as she has not yet been located since she AWOLP.
MDHHS worker has no findings in this investigation.
Documents Reviewed:
• Teaching Family Homes Group Home Program Supervisor position description
states the Program Supervisor is under direct supervision of the Residential
Director and oversees the daily program operations of the group home providing
a positive home/treatment environment for youth, supervision, and support of the
direct care workers. The group home program supervisors shall be responsible
for operating the program within guidelines established by administration and in
compliance with the State of Michigan “Rules and Regulations for Child Care
Institutions.”
• Teaching Family Homes Social Service Worker position description states the
social service worker is under supervision of the Director of Residential Services
and is responsible for youth and family development and coordination of case
management. Social service worker will be placed on rotating on-call roster. On-
call responsibilities would include covering shifts, assisting in crisis situations,
12

and providing support when needed to direct care staff. Social service worker is
to have the ability to fill in as a direct care worker as needed.
• Teaching Family Homes Program Facilitator position description states the
program facilitator is under supervision of the Program Supervisor and is
responsible for the daily program operations and well-being or youth. Program
facilitators have the authority to act on daily decisions required in the operation of
the home within the guidelines, policies and limits established by the agency,
state and accreditation standards, rules and regulations. Program facilitators
operate the program within guidelines established by administration and in
compliance with the State of Michigan “Rules and Regulations for Child Care
Institutions.
• Teaching Family Homes Direct Care Worker position description states direct
care worker is under supervision of the Program Supervisor and shall work as
part of a treatment team in the home. Direct care worker responsibilities include
maintaining safety in the home and on the grounds. Direct care worker
participates in the operation of the program within guidelines established by
administration and in compliance with the State of Michigan “Rules and
Regulations for Child Care Institutions.
• Teaching Family Homes of Upper Michigan Internet use policy states authorized
representatives of Teaching Family Homes have the right and obligation to limit
and/or revoke internet access for any youth at any time.
• Teaching Family Homes of Upper Michigan Cell Phone Contract states only
approved contacts can be contacted, only use during privilege time, phones are
not to be used in the bedroom, only able to access approved social media sites,
no posting pictures of self or others, youth are not to share information about
other residents or staff, phones are not to be used for illegal purposes, youth will
not share their phone with any other youth in the home and if these rules are
broken there will be consequences and may impact ability to continue with cell
phone use.
• Teaching Family Homes Cell Phones Guidelines state youth are permitted to use
cell phone once they reach the achievement system and with
caseworker/parental approval. If a youth is an active risk to AWOLP or to use a
phone for inappropriate/sexual reasons, they will not have permission to use the
phone until no longer a risk. This will be determined by the social service worker
and the program supervisor.
• Teaching Family Homes Cell Phone Consequences states if a youth earns a
strike regarding cell phone use, the cell phone will be put away for the remainder
of privilege time until the next time they earn it. Any AWOLP, illegal, sexting,
highly inappropriate use of the phone, will result in losing phone privileges until
supervisors and social service worker determine if and when the phone is able to
be used again.
• Youth A Behavior Management Plan/ Trauma Safety Plan dated 4/22/2022
states Youth A has reported that Youth B makes inappropriate comments about
13

her body and touched her butt. Staff always need eyes and ears on Youth A
when she is interacting with Youth B.
• Youth B Behavior Management/ Trauma Safety Plan dated 4/22/2022 states
Youth B has a history of AWOLP from South Bluff and other facilities, finds ways
to communicate with others on the internet, has hidden cell phone on person to
share with other youth in the home, has communicated with people on the
internet looking for a ride away from the facility, has sext people on Facebook,
has made inappropriate comments about Youth A’s body and touched Youth A’s
butt, has encouraged other youth to run from the facility and has hid a cell phone
on their person for over a month. Staff need to enforce rules of the program.
Staff need to monitor all Youth B’s electronic use. Staff always need to monitor
Youth B’s conversations with other youth. Staff need to have eyes and ears on
Youth B when interacting with Youth A. Staff need to stop any inappropriate
conversations with Youth B.
• Teaching Family Homes of Upper Michigan Youth B Safety Plan dated 3/25/2022
states Teaching Family Homes will maintain proper supervision of Youth B,
including but not limited to 15-minute room checks (varied) when in bedroom.
When Youth B is talking to other youth, staff will be within ear shot of them and
monitor all conversations.
• Incident Report dated 5/9/2022 states Youth B was encouraging Youth A to go to
her room for a sleepover. Youth B provided Youth A with a cell phone and laptop
and encouraged her to use them. Youth A and Youth B were talking to multiple
people on different platforms. Youth A and Youth B had a man masturbate on
the screen they were watching.
• Incident Report dated 5/10/2022 states Staff 1 knocked on Youth A’s door to
notify her that dinner was ready, and Youth A swore at Staff 1. Staff 1 opened
Youth A’s door and Youth A was skyping a man while she was topless. Staff 1
closed Youth A’s door.
• Incident Report dated 5/10/2022 states Youth A and Youth B wanted in the den
and were told no by staff due to not following rules by using the cell phones and
laptop. Youth A and Youth B went outside closing the door behind them to try to
access the den through the window. Staff 1 and Staff 2 closed and locked the
window. Youth A and Youth B began banging on the front door for Staff 1 and
Staff 2 to let them in the house and when staff did not, Youth A and Youth B ran
to the fire exit door and Youth B kicked in the door. Youth A and Youth B were
threating to assault staff. Youth A and Youth B entered Youth B’s room for 20
minutes. Youth A and Youth B then went to Youth A’s room and continued to
contact people from the internet, Skype and Facetime them. Staff 1 sat outside
of Youth A’s door and listened to Youth A and Youth B’s conversation. Youth A
and Youth B were making plans to AWOLP from the facility. Youth A and Youth
B had sexually explicit conversations with unknown men. Youth A was saying
“guess I am sucking your dick all night”, “wait until I get there, you are going to
fuck me so hard”, “daddy, I want to see it faster, I like it fast.” Staff eventually
14

opened the door to see Youth A and Youth B laying in Youth A’s bed. Youth A
and Youth B eventually separated.
• Incident Report dated 5/11/2022 states Youth A and Youth B were outside
together using unapproved cell phones. Youth A and Youth B came into the
home and found staff had removed Youth B’s laptop from her room. Youth A and
Youth B began yelling at staff and walked out of the house. Youth A and Youth B
were followed by staff down the road until staff lost sight of Youth A and Youth B.
Staff contacted police and followed the AWOLP process.
• Staff 1’s personnel file: There was no disciplinary record and Staff 1 completed
cell phone rules for youth on 3/16/2022 and de-escalation techniques and Handle
with Care training on 10/20/2021.
• Staff 2’s personnel file: There was no disciplinary record and Staff 2 completed
cell phone rules for youth on 3/16/2022 and Handle with Care training on
10/20/2021 and 8/6/2021.
• Staff 3’s personnel file: There was no disciplinary record and Staff 3 completed
cell phone rules for youth on 3/16/2022 and Handle with Care training on
12/10/2021 and 6/2/2022.
• Supervisor 1’s personnel file: There was no disciplinary record and Supervisor 1
completed cell phone rules for youth on 3/16/2022, technology usage on
3/2/2022, and Handle with Care training on 10/20/2021 and 6/2/2022.
• Supervisor 2’s personnel file: There was no disciplinary record and Supervisor 2
completed cell phone rules for youth on 3/16/2022 and Handle with Care training
on 10/20/2021 and 6/2/2022.
• Administrator 1’s personnel file: There was no disciplinary record and
Administrator 1 completed cell phone rules for youth on 3/16/2022 and Handle
with Care Instructor certification training on 10/27/2021.
• Administrator 2’s personnel file: There was no disciplinary record and
Administrator 2 completed cell phone rules for youth on 3/16/2022.
• Administrator 3’s personnel file: There was no disciplinary record and
Administrator 3 completed Youth Safety training on 1/11/2022.
• Youth Truancy Policy states if a resident does leave the group home, Teaching
Family Homes’ staff will make every attempt to locate the resident and return that
resident back to group home including physically following the resident and
encouraging him to return to the group home and /or involving the police as
indicated. If staff lose sight of the youth for 1 hour the staff will notify law
enforcement and file a runaway report and notify on-call, the residential director and
CEO.
15

APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4126 Sufficiency of staff.
The licensee shall have a sufficient number of
administrative, supervisory, social service, direct care, and
other staff on duty to perform the prescribed functions
required by these administrative rules and in the agency's
program statement and to provide for the continual needs,
protection, and supervision of residents.
ANALYSIS: The facility is found in noncompliance as staff reported they did
not feel safe intervening to attempt to take the cell phones and
the laptop computer away from the youth as staff felt Youth A
and Youth B would assault them. Staff were aware that the
youth were having inappropriate sexual conversations, Youth A
was found to be topless on a video chat with an unknown male,
Youth A and Youth B were engaging an unknown adult male to
masturbate for them over video, Youth A and Youth B were
planning to AWOLP from the facility and Youth A and Youth B’s
safety plans were not being followed due to staff not feeling safe
to intervene. Staff did not let Youth A and Youth B back into the
house as the door locked after they exited the house due to staff
feeling unsafe. Supervisors and Administrators were made
aware of these concerns and failed to provide adequate
direction to staff to intervene.
TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE:
The agency needs to update the Youth Truancy Policy to reflect
law enforcement is contacted immediately when staff lose sight
of youth.
CONCLUSION: REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
SIR2021C0128041 dated 08/09/2021, CAP Approved 10/20/2021
SIR2021C0102014 dated 03/22/2021, CAP Approved 06/07/2021
ALLEGATION:
Youth were out of the direct supervision of staff and variable interval eye on checks
of the youth were not completed in intervals not to exceed 15 minutes.
INVESTIGATION:
Interviews:
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 5/12/2022 and 5/17/2022 in
collaboration with MDHHS worker. Staff 1 reported she sat outside Youth A’s
bedroom door with the door closed and listened to Youth A and Youth B’s
conversation for two and a half hours. Staff 1 did not have a visual on Youth A and
Youth B. Staff 1 reported Youth A and Youth B would come out to go to the
bathroom and then go back into the bedroom and close the door. Staff 1 reported
16

she opened Youth A’s bedroom door 2-3 times during the two and a half hours.
Staff 1 reported 15-minute checks were not completed during the two and a half
hours. Staff 1 reported Youth A and Youth B exited the house without permission on
5/10/2022 and would go outside to the hammock. Staff 1 reported while Youth A
and Youth B were outside the house that Staff 2 was working with another youth that
was having a rough day and she was watching the remainder of the youth and
preparing dinner. Staff 1 reported Youth A and Youth B were outside the home
where she could see them however, she was unable to hear their conversation for
about 20 minutes. Staff 1 reported Youth A and Youth B both have safety plans,
and the safety plans indicate staff are to be within hearing distance to monitor their
conversation.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 5/17/2022 in collaboration
with MDHHS worker. Staff 2 reported staff did not attempt to look through the
outside of Youth A’s bedroom window to check on Youth A and Youth B while they
were in Youth A’s bedroom unsupervised because she was unsure if they would
have been able to see through the window. Staff 2 reported Staff 1 sat outside Youth
A’s bedroom door while Youth A and Youth B were inside with the door closed and
listened to their conversation. Staff 2 reported Youth A and Youth B were exiting the
house without permission on 5/10/2022 and would go to the hammock. Staff 2
reported on 5/10/2022 Youth A and Youth B were outside the house using
technology inappropriately. Staff 2 reported she was checking on Youth A and
Youth B by watching them from inside the house by looking out the window.
Supervisor 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 5/17/2022 in
collaboration with MDHHS worker and via phone on 6/10/2022. Supervisor 2
reported staff did not have a visual on Youth A and Youth B while they were in Youth
A’s room. Supervisor 2 reported staff did not attempt to look through the outside
bedroom window to check on the youth as staff would need a step stool to see in the
window. Supervisor 2 reported he was aware at the time that Staff 1 and Staff 2
were not having visual checks on Youth A and Youth B due to Staff 1 and Staff 2
feeling unsafe. Supervisor 2 reported he did not attempt to open Youth A’s bedroom
door to do a visual check on Youth A and Youth B due to the youth making threats
that they would assault staff. Supervisor 2 reported Administrator 3 had advised for
staff to not physically intervene.
Administrator 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 5/31/2022 in
collaboration with MDHHS worker via phone. Administrator 2 reported he is
aware Youth A and Youth B were in Youth A’s room together for two and a half
hours. Administrator 2 reported if staff did not complete 15-minute checks that
licensing rules were not followed.
17

Documents Reviewed:
• Teaching Family Homes South Bluff Room Check policy states when youth
are in their bedrooms staff shall visually observe and identify each youth
every 15 minutes on a variable schedule. Staff shall enter each bedroom and
visually observe/identify the youth. Identification is defined as seeing the
assigned youth’s face.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4127 Staff to resident ratio.
(4) When residents are asleep or otherwise outside of the
direct supervision of staff, staff shall perform variable
interval, eye-on checks of residents. The time between the
variable interval checks shall not exceed fifteen minutes.
ANALYSIS: The facility is found in noncompliance as Youth A and Youth B
were in Youth A’s bedroom for two and a half hours with the
door closed and Staff 1 reported she did not complete eyes-on
checks of the youth in variable intervals not to exceed 15
minutes.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
It is recommended upon receipt of an acceptable corrective plan the license be
modified to a First Provisional.
6/9/2022
